DataElement.preferredName: United States Mortality Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program Database Case Count CaseVariableCount
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean.:the ratio of deaths in an area to the population of that area; expressed per 1000 per year.:A cancer registry mandated under the National Cancer Act of 1971 to operate and maintain a population-based cancer reporting system, reporting periodically estimates of cancer incidence and mortality in the United States. The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results (SEER) Program is a continuing project of the National Cancer Institute of the National Institutes of Health. Among its goals, in addition to assembling and reporting cancer statistics, are the monitoring of annual cancer incident trends and the promoting of studies designed to identify factors amenable to cancer control interventions. (From a brochure of the National Cancer Institute, NIH Publication No. 91-3074, October 1990):An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing._A problem requiring investigation.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity._Number of cases

Concepts.definition: A country in North America, between Canada and Mexico, bordering both the North Atlantic Ocean and the North Pacific Ocean.
The proportion of deaths occurring in a population over a specified time.

Concepts.longName: Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results Program
Concepts.definition: A program of the National Cancer Institute that provides information on cancer statistics in an effort to reduce the cancer burden among the U.S. population.
An information set with a regular structure.  Although it can be applied to any set of information the term was invented to refer to computerized data, and is used almost exclusively in computing.

Property.preferredDefinition: A problem requiring investigation.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The number of values for which a given condition holds; an indcation of how many objects may participate in a given relationship.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The number of values for which a given condition holds; an indication of how many objects may participate in a given relationship; the property of being multiple.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
